metadata.titleEn: SHRIMP U-Pb zircon ages and Hf-O isotopic data of Paleozoic ophiolites in Lincang Lancang area, western Yunnan
metadata.description: This data set includes SHRIMP U-Pb zircon dating and O isotope data of Banpo Yakou ophiolite in the eastern part of the Qinghai Tibet Plateau and western Yunnan. The data are from the research team of Zhai Qingguo, Institute of Geology, Chinese Academy of Geological Sciences. The formation and evolution history of the ancient Tethys suture zone in western Yunnan has always been the focus of Tethys research. In recent years, with the support of the second scientific research project, the team has carried out a detailed field geological survey of Banpo Yakou ophiolite in Lancang Puer area, western Yunnan. On this basis, based on high-precision (ion probe) U-Pb dating and O isotope analysis of zircon in gabbro and plagiogranite, The formation age of ophiolite in this area (313~305 Ma) has been recovered, and its O isotope is a typical depleted mantle source area（ δ 18O value is about 5.5 ‰). On this basis, combined with the whole rock geochemical study, it is considered that the ophiolites in this area are of typical back arc basin origin, and the Late Carboniferous Paleo Tethys trench arc system has been reconstructed. In addition, the data further include zircon Hf isotope of Banpo ophiolite and zircon U-Pb geochronology of Mengku Shuangjiang ophiolite recently obtained by the project team. These data were obtained by using high-precision secondary ion probe (SHRIMP II) at the Beijing Ion Probe Center, and zircon Hf isotope data were obtained by (MC) - LA-ICP-MS multi receiver plasma mass spectrometry. The data quality is excellent, and can be used for the comparative study of the formation and evolution of Tethys on the Tibetan Plateau and the evolution of the oceans.
metadata.instructions: The data is in Excel form, and the file naming principle is based on region+sample nature+analysis method+data content.

Late Carboniferous ophiolites from the southern Lancangjiang belt, SW China: Implication for the arc–back-arc system in the eastern Paleo-Tethys. Lithos, 344-345, 134-146.

Definition.Question: What is SHRIMP U-Pb dating in the context of zircon analysis?
Definition.Answer: SHRIMP U-Pb dating refers to a high-precision ion probe technique used to determine the age of zircon crystals by measuring the ratio of uranium to lead isotopes. This method is utilized to obtain geological dating, particularly in the study of ophiolites in regions such as the eastern Tibetan Plateau.

Causal Consequence.Question: What are the potential outcomes of utilizing high precision ion probe U-Pb dating and O isotope analysis on zircon minerals for understanding the formation and evolution of ophiolites in ancient tectonic suture zones?
Causal Consequence.Answer: Utilizing high precision ion probe U-Pb dating and O isotope analysis on zircon minerals can lead to a more accurate determination of ophiolite formation ages, which in the case of the studied region are identified as 313 ~ 305 Ma. This approach also provides insights into the O isotope characteristics, indicating a typical depleted mantle source (with δ18O values around 5.5‰), which helps in reconstructing the tectonic history and understanding the genesis of the ophiolites as back-arc basin origins. This data can be used in broader comparisons of Tethys evolution and oceanic processes.
